attachments.title: Remove base64 from protocol by ghaskins · Pull Request #43 · hyperledger/fabric-chaintool · GitHub
attachments.text: This was a leftover from when the fabric transport was string based. Since we can now send raw bytes, we might as well use them since its more space and time efficient to avoid the base64 encode/d...
attachments.fallback: GitHub: Remove base64 from protocol by ghaskins · Pull Request #43 · hyperledger/fabric-chaintool

text: <@U0UHG4VP1>: I imported all of the GH issues over to JIRA: <https://jira.hyperledger.org/browse/FAB-2044?jql=project%20%3D%20FAB%20AND%20component%20%3D%20fabric-chaintool>
<@U0UHG4VP1>: (sorry for traffic on legacy slack, most users havent moved yet and I didnt want them to miss)
but I think we are ready for the gerrit move whenever you are, but make sure we coordinate so we can restore the URLs as quickly as possible
I do wonder, perhaps we can stage the mirror first
e.g. leave <http://github.com/hyperledger/fabric-chaintool|github.com/hyperledger/fabric-chaintool> in place, set up gerrit with a gh mirror to a different name
get all the patches/binaries imported, and then do the switch in one fell swoop
<@U0KPFAZNF> the mirror doesn't work like that, the repos have to have the same name
We will have to just pick a time window and work quickly
